content.webTitle: Classical CD of the week: Tchaikovsky & Verdi, Amsterdam Sinfonietta

fields.headline: Classical CD of the week
fields.bodyText: Tchaikovsky felt such affection for Florence, where he fled Russian woes to sketch his great opera The Queen of Spades in just 44 days in early 1890, that he chose to commemorate it in one of his most personal, affecting chamber works. Later that year, after orchestrating the opera back in the Russian countryside, he felt moved to write this string sextet, the Souvenir de Florence , its adagio ranking among the most touching music even his high romanticism ever wrought. This lush performance by the Amsterdam Sinfonietta is coupled with a rare chance to hear Verdi's only instrumental composition, also steeped in Italian warmth and charm. · To order Souvenir de Florence for £14.99 incl. p&p, call the Observer Music Service on 0870 066 7813
